text: most baked pasta casseroles are
delicious but maybe not so exciting this
one uses crispy roasted wild mushrooms
to just bring the whole thing to a new
level use as many different kinds of
mushrooms as you can get boy stur
mushrooms or maitake or chanterelle baby
Bella's white mushrooms those are
fantastic here so the mushrooms are
going to lose about 50% of their volume
when you put them in the oven so what
you want to do is cut them into pieces
that are roughly twice as big as you
want them to turn out the roasted
mushrooms are exactly like bacon except
mushroom instead of pig so this is what
you're looking for with the mushrooms
they are very crispy almost just on the
other side of birth while those are
baking and cooling you can assemble all
your other ingredients ricotta fontina
cream grated Parmesan some herbs and
some chopped garlic what's nice about
using fontina instead of say mozzarella
which is usually what you find in a
pasta bake is that the fontina melts
really nicely it kind of oozes instead
of stretches when you cut it and I've
got my pasta which is cooked al dente
it's still firm in the middle because it
finishes cooking
voila bakes you could actually just eat
it
right now like this and it would be
fantastic
I'll bet it would be it would be yeah
you know that this is done when you look
it in the oven and it's bubbling and the
cheese is all melted and it takes all of
your willpower not to just dive headlong
into the dish then it's ready you should
really make this dish because let me
tell you my baked pasta game it is
strong
